head.title: Spice Blends in Martha Stewart Colors

hedline.hl1: Spice Blends in Martha Stewart Colors

abstract.p: Daniel Orr, chef at Guastavino, creates Kitchen D'Orr herbs and spices, seasonings packed in what look like small industrial paint cans; photo (S)

block.p: A dab of Russian Red, a swirl of Mellow Yellow. These seasonings could bring out the artist in any cook. Packed in what look like small industrial paint cans, Kitchen D'Orr herbs and spices, created by Daniel Orr, the chef at Guastavino's, hold some surprises.

Russian Red's offbeat ingredient is annatto, a reddish-yellow seed blended with pomegranate and paprika to create a cool, fruity sweetness. Mellow Yellow is a mild curry powder rich in cardamom, which gives it an unexpected fragrance. Aux Poivres, a pepper blend (above), has great depth and complexity.
